related_questions.question: What percent of the world uses solar energy 2017?
related_questions.snippet: At the end of 2018, worldwide solar PV power is expected to exceed 500GW capable of producing roughly 2.8 percent of the worldwide electricity demand. The EU's share in 2017 is about 26 percent of the world-wide installed capacity and can provide about 4.5 percent of its electricity demand.Dec 18, 2018

related_questions.question: How much of the world's energy is renewable 2017?
related_questions.snippet: In 2023, bioenergy will remain the predominant source of renewable energy, although its share of total renewable energy declines from 50%, in 2017, to 46% as the expansion of both solar PV and wind accelerates in the electricity sector.
related_questions.title: Renewables 2018 - International Energy Agency

related_questions.question: What percent of solar energy is used in the world?
related_questions.snippet: A new analysis by Bloomberg New Energy Finance says that 50 percent of the world's energy will come from solar and wind by 2050. In 2015, wind and solar made up only 7 percent of global electricity generation.Jun 22, 2018
related_questions.title: Renewables Will Make Up 50 Percent of the World's Energy by 2050

related_questions.question: How much solar energy is produced in the US?
related_questions.snippet: As of the end of 2017, the United States had over 50 gigawatts (GW) of installed photovoltaic capacity. In the twelve months through December 2018, utility scale solar power generated 66.6 terawatt-hours (TWh), 1.66% of total U.S. electricity.
